basic.floral_language:
Prunus triloba
Floriography: bright, sunny, Tough
Prunus triloba leaves look like elm leaves in a broadly elliptic shape with toothed margins. Flowers like plum. A deciduous shrub or flowering plum tree, leaves grow after flowering. Flowers like plum, single-layer multi-layer petal in pink. 
Prunus triloba likes sunshine, tolerates half shade, need to avoid direct sunlight in summer noontime. Blossom in April-May for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-May, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, slight shade tolerance
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
